summary: The Downwinder Commemoration Act of 2025 directs the Secretaries of the Army, Air Force, and Interior to place plaques honoring the Downwinder communities of New Mexico. These communities suffered detrimental health effects from radioactive fallout after the 1945 atomic bomb detonation. The bill mandates the placement of three plaques at White Sands Missile Range, Holloman Air Force Base, and White Sands National Park, respectively, within one year of the Act's enactment.
